intro: Scurrula phoebe-formosanae, commonly known as the Formosan scurrula, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Taiwan and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited geographic distribution.
